DSS.title: Can't deploy to staging via pulbot or ansible tower

comments.body:
@sandbergja I think you might be onto something with your ssh question. Just tried doing this manually and got this error: 

```
pulsys@appdeploy1:~$ sudo su - deploy
deploy@appdeploy1:~$ ssh deploy@dss-staging1.princeton.edu
The authenticity of host 'dss-staging1.princeton.edu (128.112.202.244)' can't be established.
ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:y+WbY2eLsmAUj3LsEwECIfQGTj82gg/JHG/bMsAiIbA.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added 'dss-staging1.princeton.edu' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts.

Load key "/home/deploy/.ssh/id_rsa": invalid format
deploy@dss-staging1.princeton.edu's password:
```

@sandbergja I noticed that I CAN ssh from appdeploy1 to dss-staging1 if I use the right key, though:
```
deploy@appdeploy1:~/.ssh$ ssh -i CodeDeployKey deploy@dss-staging1.princeton.edu
Welcome to Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS (GNU/Linux 5.15.0-60-generic x86_64)

 * Documentation:  https://help.ubuntu.com
 * Management:     https://landscape.canonical.com
 * Support:        https://ubuntu.com/advantage

 * Introducing Expanded Security Maintenance for Applications.
   Receive updates to over 25,000 software packages with your
   Ubuntu Pro subscription. Free for personal use.

     https://ubuntu.com/pro
Last login: Wed Mar 22 14:42:49 2023 from 172.20.217.106
```

pdc_discovery.title: SolrCloud replica node lib-solr-prod6.princeton.edu is failing for Solr Collection pdc-discovery-production-2

comments.body:
The following ConfigSets are available:

```bash
deploy@pdc-discovery-prod2:~$ curl "http://lib-solr-prod6.princeton.edu:8983/solr/admin/configs?action=LIST&omitHeader=true"
{
  "configSets":["_default",
    "cdh_shxco",
    "geniza",
    "figgy-production",
    "oawaiver-production",
    "reserves",
    "pdc-discovery-production",
    "dpul",
    "catalog-production-v2",
    "lae",
    "cicognara",
    "libwww",
    "pulmap",
    "cdh_ppa",
    "pulfalight-production",
    "dss-production"]}
```

Attempting to add a replica node for the existing `shard1` failed, as the recovery for the newly-added node is also failing:

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/70201fa1-8f5b-4bbb-83d1-6d249b35fe90)
Once this has been finished, I believe that I should be able to update the Solr Cloud alias for `pdc-discovery-production`

While the new Solr Collection was created, the Solr Documents were not migrated:

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/b1965456-7385-455a-8a4f-8bec26997a7d)

pdc_discovery.title: Data sync/transfer issue between DataSpace and Discovery

comments.body:
Manually running the reindex in production took care of these issue, the 4 records are now available in PDC Discovery:
* [dsp01gt54kr255](https://datacommons.princeton.edu/discovery/?search_field=all_fields&q=dsp01gt54kr255)
* [dsp01fq977z011](https://datacommons.princeton.edu/discovery/?search_field=all_fields&q=dsp01fq977z011)
* [dsp01c247dw32c](https://datacommons.princeton.edu/discovery/?search_field=all_fields&q=dsp01c247dw32c) 
* [dsp01j098zf33b](https://datacommons.princeton.edu/discovery/?search_field=all_fields&q=dsp01j098zf33b) 

We did notice that the problem is only in production, the four records were already in staging. The culprit seems to be that we have an extra condition in production that is stopping the process. 

The [reindex task](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_discovery/blob/main/lib/tasks/index.rake#L5-L13) calls the [delete index task](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_discovery/blob/main/lib/tasks/index.rake#L30-L35) and that is not allowed in production.
So, I am able to deploy to pas staging locally without making any changes. I suspect the Princeton and Slavery issue may be different from the DSS issue.

pulfalight.title: [PULFALight/production] Errno::ECONNREFUSED: Failed to open TCP connection to aspace.princeton.edu:443 (Connection refused - connect(2) for 44.224.179.199:443)

comments.body: This machine connects successfully from the rails console.
also related: https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/65922/faults/82765616#notice-summary
okay it's not connecting from rails console now.

From Lyrasis support:

```
Sorry about that Anna, we put a new firewall rule in place to rate limit logins to help defend against brute-force attacks, and apparently that's picking up Arclight.
For some reason Arclight does the login thing once a second. 
I'll make a change to the rules on the server.
You might just want to double check with Arclight about that login rate, once a second seems surprising.
```

In this case the source of all the traffic was the PACSCL discovery harvester.
Looks like vm2 is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
